p: In this study, aging, sepsis, bacteraemia, HIV/AIDS, hematologic markers, exposure to pollution, local climate, global climate variability and combined global and local climate were identified as potential univariate predictors of HM incidence. As reported in the literature [ 21, 22] and by the present study, sex (sex ratio = 1) was not significantly associated with AML, with CML or with ALL. However, male sex or female sex were significantly associated with other HM subtypes, as follows: male predominance in the MM and MDS subtypes and female predominance in the CLL subtype.
